subject: Re: Oncobeta - Tracking on the website

full_threads.body:
Hi Alyssa,

Sure, total spent for this month is 70mins for the overall task. Emails has been successfully updated.

[152091] Re: Oncobeta - Add new treatment site to website - 5mins
[152880] [Request received] Oncobeta - What enquiry forms go where - 35mins
[152078] Re: Oncobeta - Tracking on the website - 30mins

##- Please type your reply above this line -## You are registered as a CC on this help desk request (support.combinate.me/hc/requests/30346). Reply to this email to add a comment to the request. Alyssa Venturanza (Combinate Support) 7 May 2025, 10:04 GMT+10 Thanks for the explanation, Joel. We weren't aware of that. Does this mean we must recreate ALL the other site forms as well? Or just these two? Can you also confirm how much time we've spent on this update / in this ticket in total, and whether the emails were successfully updated? Regards, Alyssa Combinate support@combinate.me www.combinate.me 1300 247 018 WolfIQ Support 7 May 2025, 09:53 GMT+10 Hi Alyssa, Sure, upon checking, the both pages is using "simple contact form" widget, you can only set a specific 1 specific email regardless of which page you are using. So we have decided to recreate the forms to elementor forms. This will be beneficial as well once they go ahead with the GA4 form submission triggers. Thanks, Joel Maligalig support@wolfiq.com.au Impressed with our service? Click here to review us on Google! Your website Care Plan includes Developer Time, which is used to complete your requests. The included time varies across our plans:
  • Lite Care Plans - 15 minutes / month
  • Pro Care Plans - 120 minutes / month
  • Expert Care Plans - 300 minutes / month
If you require extra Developer Time to complete this request, it will be billed at $129/hr inc GST. Please let us know if you would like a quote before we commence your request. {#HS:2922604208-152078#}

Hi Alyssa,

Sure, upon checking, the both pages is using "simple contact form" widget, you can only set a specific 1 specific email regardless of which page you are using. So we have decided to recreate the forms to elementor forms. This will be beneficial as well once they go ahead with the GA4 form submission triggers.

WolfIQ Support, 6 May 2025, 11:18 GMT+10

Hi Alyssa,

Now that they are handling **Steps 2–5** (the GTM configuration), here’s what we’ll need order to complete **Step 1** (adding the JavaScript to each Elementor form for tracking):

**1. Form Details**
For each form you'd like tracked, please send:

- The **form name** you’ve used in GTM (i.e. the value in the `formName` field like `"Contact Form"` or `"Quote Request"` ).
- The **URL** of the page where that form appears.
**2. GTM Trigger Summary**
Please confirm:

- That the **Custom Event Trigger** is named `elementor_form_submitted` .
- Any filters you've added (e.g. specific pages or form IDs), if applicable.
**3. GA4 Tag Overview (Optional but helpful)**

- The name of the **GA4 Event Tag** you created.
- The **parameters** you're sending (e.g. `form_name` , `form_id` , `page_url` ).
- Your **GA4 Measurement ID**, in case you'd like assistance testing the setup.
**4. Testing Confirmation (Optional)**

- A screenshot from **GTM Preview Mode** showing the event firing.
- Confirmation from **GA4 DebugView** or **Realtime** that the event is being received correctly.



Thanks,

**Joel Maligalig**
support@wolfiq.com.au

![wolfiq.com.au](https://lh3.google.com/u/0/d/1m3NYUuXtUVyZ313zB6byGDnpd4zEEcb2=w3024-h1646-iv2)

Alyssa Venturanza, 6 May 2025, 09:52 GMT+10

Thanks for the guidance, Joel.

Once the client has set up their GTM/GA based on Steps 2-5, what output do we need from them? Perhaps IDs, tags, etc, so we can install the tracking on the forms?

Regards,
Alyssa

Combinate
support@combinate.me

WolfIQ Support, 6 May 2025, 09:35 GMT+10

Hi Alyssa,

Sure, please see below:

### ✅ Step 1: Add Custom JavaScript to Each Form (We can do STEP 1)
In Elementor, for **each form**, do the following:

1. Go to the form’s settings.
2. Under **"Actions After Submit"**, add **"JavaScript"**.
3. In the JavaScript field, insert this snippet (update the `formName` to something unique per form):

document.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent("elementor_form_submitted", {
detail: {
formId: '{{ID}}',
formName: 'Contact Form', // Change this label per form
pageURL: window.location.href // Optional, tracks the page location
}
}));

Repeat this for each form you'd like to track, updating the `formName` value accordingly.


### ✅ Step 2: Create a Custom Event Trigger in GTM

1. In GTM, go to **Triggers > New**.
2. Set trigger type as **Custom Event**.
3. Event Name: `elementor_form_submitted` .
4. Trigger on **All Custom Events** (or filter by form ID later if needed).


### ✅ Step 3: Create Data Layer Variables
Create the following variables in GTM to extract form data:

- `event_detail_formId` → Data Layer Variable: `event.detail.formId`
- `event_detail_formName` → Data Layer Variable: `event.detail.formName`
- `event_detail_pageURL` → Data Layer Variable: `event.detail.pageURL`_(optional)_


### ✅ Step 4: Set Up GA4 Event Tag in GTM

1. Go to **Tags > New** and create a **GA4 Event Tag**.
2. Select your existing GA4 Configuration Tag.
3. Set **Event Name** to: `form_submission` .
Add Event Parameters:

- `form_id` → `{{event_detail_formId}}`
- `form_name` → `{{event_detail_formName}}`
- `page_url` → `{{event_detail_pageURL}}`_(optional)_
Attach the **Custom Event Trigger** you created earlier.


### ✅ Step 5: Test the Setup

- Use GTM’s **Preview Mode** to test form submissions.
Submit each Elementor form and verify:

- The correct event is triggered in GTM.
- Parameters such as `form_name` populate properly.
- Use **GA4 DebugView** or **Realtime reports** to confirm events are received.



Thanks,

**Joel Maligalig**
support@wolfiq.com.au

![wolfiq.com.au](https://lh3.google.com/u/0/d/1m3NYUuXtUVyZ313zB6byGDnpd4zEEcb2=w3024-h1646-iv2)
**Impressed with our service? Click here to review us on Google!**

WolfIQ Support, 30 Apr 2025, 07:46 GMT+10

Hi Alyssa,

I hope all is well.

Just wondering what events you're currently tracking on the website?

- Upon checking, Google analytics and we can see Microsoft Clarity (we don't have access to both)

They were looking at 'pages and screens' under user engagement on GA, and wondering why it says 0 forms submitted under event count, when we know for the Cabrini dinner page we've had at least 11 submitted?

- I don't think the GA was not setup to grab the form events. but can create an event that tracks it

I understand that this could be the set-up prior to the migration of the site to us. Can you confirm?

- If the there was a previous GA4 event setup already it should be carried over the migration.

Can you please also confirm what email address the patient enquiries are going to on this page and where the clinician enquiries are going to on this page?

- Information for Patients - (No email set) - we've changed it to info@oncobeta.com.au
- Information for Healthcare Providers - (No email set) we've changed it to info@oncobeta.com.au

For each form you'd like tracked, please send:
  • The form name you’ve used in GTM (i.e. the value in the formName field like "Contact Form" or "Quote Request" ).
  • The URL of the page where that form appears.
2. GTM Trigger Summary
Please confirm:
  • That the Custom Event Trigger is named elementor_form_submitted .
  • Any filters you've added (e.g. specific pages or form IDs), if applicable.
3. GA4 Tag Overview (Optional but helpful)
  • The name of the GA4 Event Tag you created.
  • The parameters you're sending (e.g. form_name , form_id , page_url ).
  • Your GA4 Measurement ID, in case you'd like assistance testing the setup.
4. Testing Confirmation (Optional)
  • A screenshot from GTM Preview Mode showing the event firing.
  • Confirmation from GA4 DebugView or Realtime that the event is being received correctly.

##- Please type your reply above this line -##

You are registered as a CC on this help desk request (support.combinate.me/hc/requests/30346).
Reply to this email to add a comment to the request.

----------------------------------------------

Alyssa Venturanza, 6 May 2025, 09:52 GMT+10

Thanks for the guidance, Joel.

Once the client has set up their GTM/GA based on Steps 2-5, what output do we need from them? Perhaps IDs, tags, etc, so we can install the tracking on the forms?

Regards,
Alyssa

Combinate
support@combinate.me
www.combinate.me
1300 247 018

----------------------------------------------

WolfIQ Support, 6 May 2025, 09:35 GMT+10

Hi Alyssa,

Sure, please see below:

### ✅ Step 1: Add Custom JavaScript to Each Form (We can do STEP 1)
In Elementor, for **each form**, do the following:

1. Go to the form’s settings.
2. Under **"Actions After Submit"**, add **"JavaScript"**.
3. In the JavaScript field, insert this snippet (update the `formName` to something unique per form):

document.dispatchEvent(new CustomEvent("elementor_form_submitted", {
detail: {
formId: '{{ID}}',
formName: 'Contact Form', // Change this label per form
pageURL: window.location.href // Optional, tracks the page location
}
}));

Repeat this for each form you'd like to track, updating the `formName` value accordingly.


### ✅ Step 2: Create a Custom Event Trigger in GTM

1. In GTM, go to **Triggers > New**.
2. Set trigger type as **Custom Event**.
3. Event Name: `elementor_form_submitted` .
4. Trigger on **All Custom Events** (or filter by form ID later if needed).


### ✅ Step 3: Create Data Layer Variables
Create the following variables in GTM to extract form data:

- `event_detail_formId` → Data Layer Variable: `event.detail.formId`
- `event_detail_formName` → Data Layer Variable: `event.detail.formName`
- `event_detail_pageURL` → Data Layer Variable: `event.detail.pageURL`_(optional)_


### ✅ Step 4: Set Up GA4 Event Tag in GTM

1. Go to **Tags > New** and create a **GA4 Event Tag**.
2. Select your existing GA4 Configuration Tag.
3. Set **Event Name** to: `form_submission` .
Add Event Parameters:

- `form_id` → `{{event_detail_formId}}`
- `form_name` → `{{event_detail_formName}}`
- `page_url` → `{{event_detail_pageURL}}`_(optional)_
Attach the **Custom Event Trigger** you created earlier.


### ✅ Step 5: Test the Setup

- Use GTM’s **Preview Mode** to test form submissions.
Submit each Elementor form and verify:

- The correct event is triggered in GTM.
- Parameters such as `form_name` populate properly.
- Use **GA4 DebugView** or **Realtime reports** to confirm events are received.



Thanks,

**Joel Maligalig**
support@wolfiq.com.au

Alyssa Venturanza (Combinate Support)

29 Apr 2025, 11:23 GMT+10

Hey team,

The client has some enquiries about https://www.oncobeta.com.au/, can you advise please?

  • Just wondering what events you're currently tracking on the website?
  • They were looking at 'pages and screens' under user engagement on GA, and wondering why it says 0 forms submitted under event count, when we know for the Cabrini dinner page we've had at least 11 submitted?


I understand that this could be the set-up prior to the migration of the site to us. Can you confirm?

Can you please also confirm what email address the patient enquiries are going to on this page and where the clinician enquiries are going to on this page?

Let us know please, thanks!

Regards,
Alyssa

Combinate
support@combinate.me
www.combinate.me
1300 247 018
